Text: RE Mark Haedickes Visit to Mexico CityOriginal Message From Elbertson Janette On Behalf Of Haedicke Mark E Sent Tuesday October AM To Alatorre Jaime Subject Mark Haedickes Visit to Mexico City Janette With reference to our telephone conversation of last Friday I talked to Jaime Alatorre He will not be able to be with Mr Haedicke tomorrow Tuesday Oct at oclock as he already had made an appoitnment He mentioned that maybe the best time would be after finishing the staff meeting He thinks Mr Haedicke will also be in the same meeting Do you think they could meet tomorrow at around pm If this is not possible he will talk to you later as he is out of the office in a Seminar this morning Thank you Ma Elena

Dinner with V Fox Cc Ken Federico Sada who is travelling with President elect Vicente Fox in South America called me this morning and asked me to give you the confirmed list of attendees to the dinner in New York Wednesday August PM at the Watteau Room of the St Regis Hotel Sanford I Weill Citigroup Inc Chairman and CEO Hendrick Verfaille Monsanto Co President and CEO William B Harrison Jr Chase Manhattan Corp Chairman and CEO Raymond V Gilmartin Merck and Company Inc Chairman and CEO Michael Armstrong ATT Chairman and CEO Stephen M Wolf US Airways Chairman and CEO Kenneth L Lay Enron Corp Chairman and CEO Pending confirmation Douglas A Warner III JP Morgan Chairman According to Federico if there is any late cancellation no one will be substituted Also there is a small possibility that the dinner could take place in Washington rather than NY based on Foxs meeting with President Clinton they are still working on the final agenda Max and myself are working on the background information that you will need and will keep you posted of any changes best regards jaime

Mid year evaluation Cc Kim I am enclosing the mid year evaluation of the two people that support me in our Mexico City Office It is my understanding that the rating is or One being the highest ranking MARIA ELENA MENDOZA Rating She is the executive assistant of the Office of the Chairman at Enron de Mexico and maintains the permanent relationships with the Executive offices of most of our clients and Government officials a network of contacts that she has developed over the last years Through this she provides tremendous support in the organization of complex agendas In this capacity she helps me coordinate the meetings of an important Business Group which I chair that includes the largest Foreign Corporations in Mexico She also provides support to most Enron executives that visit Mexico City and coordinates their appointments Additionally she serves as the administrative liaison between our Mexico City and Monterrey office being responsible for payments and maintenance of our installations As a whole she is a very important asset to Enrons presence in Mexico ANASTASIO MARTINEZ ZAPATA Rating He serves as clerk office support messenger and chuffer to Enron de Mexico Mexico City office He is extremely loyal and is always available to our office needs working nights and weekends whenever needed He provides support to different Enron employees that travel to Mexico City from Houston or Monterrey by driving them around making sure that they are secure throughout their stay in Mexico Additionally he takes care of many maintenance related items in our office He is also a very valuable asset to our operation in Mexico City I hope this is the type of report that it is required Regards jaime

Meeting with Energy Secretary Martenspst I had an hour long fruitful meeting with Energy Secretary Martens last night He was very supportive of our import project for industrials but I did not convince him on the concept of CFEs bids ie Rio Bravo IV to be modified so as to call for IPP or PPAs imported power indifferently He gave me two solid arguments CFE ie Mexico cannot depend on imported power from the US Texas on a long term basis years since there is no formal agreement between both countries that will support it This is an even stronger argument after the September th events when the US can call for national emergencies whenever needed Secretary Martens shared with me the problems they faced in Baja California during the California energy crisis when Natural Gas supply was cut out on three or four occasions because of a State Government emergency decree ie supply contracts between SDGE and CFE were not honored We are very late to request modifications on the Rio Bravo IV bid which has been postponed for early December He offered to look into it for bids providing the bilateral agreement is in place Regarding the import project for industrials he volunteered his support with TAMSA AXA DESC or DeACERO since the concept of importingtrading power in the ERCOT market is a good story for him to sell Finally he told me that the transmission cost methodology will be available by the end of this month he hopes that the CRE will load it in its Internet Site Regards Jaime

RE Vitro Cc Louise I just talked to Fernando Sanchez Ugarte Chairman of CFC Federal Competition Commission and told him of our urgency to have our request approved in the next two weeks He told me he will look into it today and will try to have it resolved asap Our lawyers should do the follow up but I am confident we will get it done in time Regards Jaime Original Message From Kitchen Louise Sent Wednesday September AM To Alatorre Jaime Subject Vitro we really really really need that to close this quarter please help as much as you can Louise Kitchen Chief Operating Officer Enron Americas Tel Fax

Great answerpst Dear Louise I just finished watching the All Employee Meeting from my computer in Mexico I was very pleased to hear the question on Mexico being asked and see your performance at answering it Yes we will do what you said and more Best regards jaime

Information for DESCs Proposal Cc I just received the information to prepare DESCs proposal I am sending a copy to Steve to Houston and the original to Marc to Monterrey first thing tomorrow morning As you will see the information is very detailed and was prepared by Protego Aspe Souza for DESC they paid for the study and Luis Tellez has asked us to keep it confidential Dr Tellez main concerns which should be reflected in our proposal are years schemes He wants to enjoy the benefits of price changes in the Texas Market He does not want to be attached to a single technology ie inside the fence power plant but rather enjoy the benefits and risks of being part of a Market Regards jaime

RE DESC Proposalpst Louise thanks for your prompt response I am getting a fair response from our guys in Monterrey although we have not submitted a proposal yet I am loading them with information in order for them to prepare the proposals during the next weeks Then we will see how good creative the proposals turn out On a different issue I had an informal talk with Sergio Gutierrez Davids eldest brother from DeAcero last week in Monterrey over dinner I would like to share the outcome with you only Regards jaime Original Message From Kitchen Louise Sent Wednesday July PM To Alatorre Jaime Subject RE DESC Proposal Apologies I had to leave before I could return your call Ill ring back tomorrow Are you getting everything you need on these proposals from teh guys in Monterrey Original Message From Jaime Alatorre Sent Monday July PM To Louise Kitchen Steve Irvin Marc Sabine Cc Jaime Williams Subject DESC Proposal I had a meeting this morning with Dr Luis Tellez former Secretary of Energy who is currently COO of Grupo DESC He is also very interested in receiving a proposal from Enron They are preparing all the information we will need and he offered to send it before the end of the week DESCs needs are MW in separate sites Luis wants to have a proposal by the middle of next week in order to discuss it with Mr Fernando Senderos Chairman CEO of DESC and his boss who will out of the country for one month as of July This is another opportunity that looks promising although our proposal will be compared with others coming from a single plant scheme or MW where we have a disadvantage at heat rate and pricing I believe we have to be more creative in the way we portrait our import scheme Lets talk about it Regards jaime

DESC Proposal Cc I had a meeting this morning with Dr Luis Tellez former Secretary of Energy who is currently COO of Grupo DESC He is also very interested in receiving a proposal from Enron They are preparing all the information we will need and he offered to send it before the end of the week DESCs needs are MW in separate sites Luis wants to have a proposal by the middle of next week in order to discuss it with Mr Fernando Senderos Chairman CEO of DESC and his boss who will out of the country for one month as of July This is another opportunity that looks promising although our proposal will be compared with others coming from a single plant scheme or MW where we have a disadvantage at heat rate and pricing I believe we have to be more creative in the way we portrait our import scheme Lets talk about it Regards jaime

TAMSA proposal Cc I met yesterday with Guillermo Vogel CEO of Tamsa MW He was interested in receiving a proposal from Enron based on an import of power scheme He offered me to give us a quick response on whether they are seriously interested He will be out of the country for two weeks and told me he will be ready to review our deal then The steps are as follows Mr Gustavo Rosas from their Veracruz site will provide all the information we require He called me today and is preparing the information Mr Rosas phone no x Marc should call Mr Rosas next Monday confirm all the information that I requested and schedule a visit to Veracruz next week since Mr Rosas wants to meet us there Prepare a proposal with and years prices that we should deliver in two weeks time So far it looks promising Regards jaime

Dinner with V FoxKen I have been told that you will not have time to meet with me prior to Mr Fox dinner in New York I have to be in NY anyhow so let me know if you feel like having a night cap after your dinner Here is some relevant information regarding the participants at the dinner and their interests in Mexico Best regards jaime Alatorredoc

Follow up on President Elect Vicente Fox Cc Ken I learned through some of the participants that the dinner with Fox in New York went well Derbez his economic advisor told me that you were particularly aggressive on the issue of deregulating electricity and dry natural gas I like that since you created a great impression I have been invited to join Mr Fox on his next trip to Europe Oct along with a group of Mexican businessmen that includes Federico Sada and Valentin Diez who participated in the NY dinner We will be visiting Paris Madrid Berlin and London I will keep you posted Best regards jaime PS Congratulations on the excellent article of the Worldlink issue of bb CEO Kenneth Lay THE POWER OF ENRONS EMARKETS

Change at Pemexwe had expected for a few months although it became imminent a week ago Adrian Lajous is leaving Pemex and will be substituted by Rogelio Montemayor I have known Rogelio for some time he is an outsider to the Energy sector but a good Economist who has held both technical positions in past Governments as well as elected officer Congressman Senator and Governor of Coahuila Rogelio is close to Francisco Labastida the PRI candidate to the Presidency electionsJuly and was proposed by Luis Tellez Secretary of Energy as a transition CEO of Pemex with whom he can work in some deregulation initiatives before the change of Government Dec This leaves our friend Luis Tellez in a very powerful position since he was able to remove both the head of CFE Pemex who were opposing his deregulation efforts Hopefully he will be able to transcend the change of Administration and keep his drive and level of influence Regards jaime

Energy ForumDear Jeff Thank you for asking me to attend on your behalf an invitation by the Baker Institute Energy Forum for a presentation and dinner with Ral Muoz the new CEO of PEMEX As you probably know he has been my friend for many years and he invited me to fly out today in a PEMEX plane to Houston On a different issue I was told by Juan Eleck a good friend of mine and a member of the Trustees of SMU of your recent appointment as Board Member Congratulations Best regards Jaime

Change at Pemexwe had expected for a few months although it became imminent a week ago Adrian Lajous is leaving Pemex and will be substituted by Rogelio Montemayor I have known Rogelio for some time he is an outsider to the Energy sector but a good Economist who has held both technical positions in past Governments as well as elected officer Congressman Senator and Governor of Coahuila Rogelio is close to Francisco Labastida the PRI candidate to the Presidency electionsJuly and was proposed by Luis Tellez Secretary of Energy as a transition CEO of Pemex with whom he can work in some deregulation initiatives before the change of Government Dec This leaves our friend Luis Tellez in a very powerful position since he was able to remove both the head of CFE Pemex who were opposing his deregulation efforts Hopefully he will be able to transcend the change of Administration and keep his drive and level of influence Regards jaime
